nodes.text: A female soldier served in the Rebel Alliance during the Galactic Civil War. In 3 ABY, she was stationed at Echo Base, the Alliance High Command's secret base on the ice planet Hoth. When the Galactic Empire attacked Echo Base, the rebel soldier was posted at the sentry post Perimeter Outpost Delta. She cheered when the first rebel transport escaped Hoth and told the nearby First Sergeant Hazram Namir the news.

The rebel soldier later received word that rebel snowspeeders had engaged enemy AT-AT walkers and that enemy reconnaissance forces were approaching Outpost Delta, which she informed Namir of. The scout forces then attacked the sentry post. The soldier was injured during the fighting, but managed to grapple onto the ankle of an AT-ST walker. Using a grenade in her free hand, she sacrificed herself to bring the walker down.

The woman served as a soldier in the Rebel Alliance during the Galactic Civil War. In 3 ABY, she operated at the Alliance High Command's secret base on the ice planet Hoth, named Echo Base. However, the Galactic Empire discovered Echo Base, forcing the command center to order the evacuation plan Code K-one-zero. The rebel soldier was posted at the trenches of Perimeter Outpost Delta, one of Echo Base's sentry posts, with orders to hold out as long as possible.

As enemy ground forces were reported on the surface, ion cannon fire flash in the sky above the outpost, and the soldier received word from command that a rebel transport had escaped Hoth. She cheered, looking over to First Sergeant Hazram Namir, who crouched in a trench nearby, and telling him over her comlink about the news she had just received. After some more time passed, the soldier received more word from the command center that snowspeeders had engaged Imperial AT-AT walkers and that enemy reconnaissance forces were now fanning out and heading towards Outpost Delta. She called Namir over to her and relayed to him what she had heard from command.

The reconnaissance forces, comprising of an AT-ST walker escorting two floating gunnery platforms which each carried snowtroopers. The two sides fought, but many soldiers at Outpost Delta were lost in the fighting. The rebel soldier was injured, but managed to cling to the ankle of the AT-ST with one arm as it stood at the south side of the trenches. In her remaining arm, she then raised a grenade which killed her along with bringing down the AT-ST.

A female individual, the rebel soldier cheered at the news of a rebel transport escaping. She informed Hazram Namir of news that the command center gave to her. When the soldier held on to the AT-ST walker with a grenade, she smiled as she raised the explosive with a smile before being killed in the subsequent explosion.
The soldier used a comlink and a grenade during her time at Outpost Delta.
The female rebel soldier appeared in the 2015 novel Battlefront: Twilight Company, written by Alexander Freed.
